alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 6:44PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Greenbrier County through 730 PM EDT... At 642 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Rupert to Roaring Mountain Summit in southeast Greenbrier County. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rainfall. Cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall could lead to flooding of poor drainage and low-lying areas. Locations impacted include... Lewisburg... White Sulphur Springs... Ronceverte... Rupert... Renick... Neola... and Falling Spring. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
